title: eth_getProof should use defaults for codeHash and storageRoot for not existing accounts
body:
Currenty, if I'm asking for `eth_getProof`  or a n on existing account I get this:

```js
{
  "accountProof": [
    "",
    "",
    "0xf87180a042e19ce051c97a620df504cff94a7f8b1501dfc03dc37136e76c2705963a4bdda0d2fa53b797c924424f59fd4d30d873896f8b77805d73b3a18273a05e7ed385a1a0c74de9bcd84d26aa55ccc889f19ba48e46731a1581b4adfce92bb94bc756fdb280808080808080808080808080"
  ],
  "address": "0x4038db9d24422bdc857efe8b0755e16ce6b5d061",
  "balance": "0x0",
  "codeHash": null,
  "nonce": "0x0",
  "storageHash": null,
  "storageProof": []
}
```
Per Definition the `codeHash` of a empty account should be `keccack(0x)` which is `0xc5d2460186f7233c927e7db2dcc703c0e500b653ca82273b7bfad8045d85a470`.

For the `storageHash` this would be an empty MerkleTrie, so the rootHash would be `0x56e81f171bcc55a6ff8345e692c0f86e5b48e01b996cadc001622fb5e363b421`

This is also how geth and parity are handling it ( I know this, because I implemented it ;-) )
